H0.text: Which chemical element is named after a university in Oakland, California. Californium

H1.text: Which chemical element is named after a university in Oakland, California. Lawrencium

H2.text: Which chemical element is named after a university in Oakland, California. Seaborgium

H3.text: Which chemical element is named after a university in Oakland, California. Berkelium

A4.text: Berkelium is named after the city of Berkeley in California, following a naming convention similar to that of Terbium, which was named after Ytterby.

A5.text: Californium is named after the state of California, not a specific university in Oakland, California.

A6.text: Lawrencium is named after Ernest Lawrence, a physicist associated with the University of California, Berkeley, not a university in Oakland, California.
